title: Introduction to Thermal Analysis and Surface Area Measurement
headline: This free online thermal analysis certification is helpful for construction materials and surface area measurements.
description: This free online thermal analysis and surface area measurement training course is helpful for a learner who wants to improve their skills in construction. You will learn about thermal methods, the application of thermal analysis to study construction materials and how you can use these techniques to understand construction materials better. Also, you will learn about the reason for surface area measurement and particle size distribution.
courseDescription:
This free online course will introduce you to thermal analysis certification as a technique commonly used to understand construction materials. You will learn about the thermal methods, the application of thermal analysis in the study of construction materials and how these applications or techniques are used to understand construction materials. This will lead you into differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), as well as the techniques and applications of DSC. Also, you will learn about the types of differential scanning calorimetry, the difference between differential thermal analysis and differential scanning calorimetry.

The course then enlightens you on the concept of surface area measurements performed on construction materials. You will gain an understanding of the reason for surface area measurement, laser diffraction, data analysis, as well as the surface area from laser diffraction. Next, you will study gas adsorption and BET theories. This will lead you into particle size distribution and specific surface area as typical aspects of surface area measurement training.

Finally, you will learn about spherical primary particles, irregular primary particles, agglomerates and aggregates. Also, you will learn about powder sampling, representative sample, sieving apparatus and analysis. Next, you will be informed on how to determine surface area, adsorption of a gas on the surface and the influence of degassing temperature. Furthermore, you will learn how you can report a specific surface area. Start learning today!
